intro: Limonia alternans, commonly known as the white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers with five petals and a prominent central pistil. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Limonia alternans thrives in humid, sunny environments and is often found in coastal areas and riverbanks.
